meanings.definition: To make a respectful gesture by bending the knees and lowering the body.
meanings.sent1: She curtseyed to the queen at the royal ball.
meanings.sent2: The little girl curtseyed before her ballet teacher.
meanings.sent3: The cat curtseyed to the mouse, pretending to be polite.
meanings.sent4: The trees curtseyed in the wind's strong embrace.
meanings.sent5: He curtseyed deeply, showing his utmost respect.

meanings.definition: Past tense of curtsey: to perform a curtsey.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she curtseyed gracefully at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The princess curtseyed elegantly in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The dog curtseyed playfully, trying to mimic his owner.
meanings.sent4: The flowers curtseyed as the sun set behind the hills.
meanings.sent5: Having curtseyed, she felt a sense of tradition and honor.
